wikipedia_page.main: Elvis Comrie (born 7 September 1959) is a former English-American football forward and coach. Comrie played three seasons in the North American Soccer League, one in Major Indoor Soccer League, one in the American Indoor Soccer Association, two in the American Soccer League and one in the American Professional Soccer League. He earned four caps with the U.S. national team in 1984. Comrie worked briefly as a stockbroker and was formerly a college soccer coach, primarily at Holy Cross. He was also the head coach of the Worcester Hydra of the USL Premier Development League in 2012.

link_mentions.page: List of United States men's international soccer players

response: Worcester began their inaugural season in May 2012, playing at Foley Stadium. They appointed former US international player, and former Holy Cross head coach, Elvis Comrie, as head coach.http://hydrafc.com/2012/03/elvis-comrie-named-head-coach-standout-coach-and-player-joins-worcester-hydra/ Their first game was against Seacoast United Phantoms, which ended in a 1-0 defeat for the Hydra. Worcester gained their first-ever win, and first-ever goals, in a 2-0 victory over Boston Victory, both goals being scored by forward Alencar Junior.http://hydrafc.com/2012/05/hydra-down-victory-2-0-for-first-win/  However, following the 2012 season, the Hydra announced it would not be returning to the PDL for the 2013 season, citing financial issues.
